question:
Consider the following statements regarding blood pressure:
  1. It is the pressure exerted by the blood on the walls of any vessel
  2. It decreases in the arteries as the distance from the heart increases
  3. It is lower in the capillaries than in the arteries
  4. It is usually lower in women than in men.
Of these statements
explanation: Blood pressure is the pressure of circulating blood on the walls of blood vessels. Most of this pressure is due to work done by the heart by pumping blood through the circulatory system. Used without further specification, \"blood pressure\" usually refers to the pressure in large arteries of the systemic circulation.
